TopicTitle: What is the point of Munar Archs

Articles.Content: I dont see why there is these munar arch on the mun, is the a point or meaning why?

The Mun arches are there as a kind of easter egg. There are two on almost exact opposite sides of the mun. Also, there are 9 total black Monoliths across Kerbin, the Mun, and Minmus, which are harder to find.
What do these black monliths look like you got a screen shot or link

Here's a monolith for you. It's a 2001: Space Odyssey nod, I would think.

Monolith

We may never know why they are there, they just are. I think since there's not "that much" stuff to do right now, as far as missions are concerned, this makes for an interesting journey, trying to find the arches and monoliths. There's a few other easter eggs in the game as well. Enjoy finding them (or most likely, stumbling upon them!) !
Thanks for that im just interested

As a side note, DarkStar, the monoliths I found on the surface of the Mun are hardly on opposite sides.

They're actually pretty much close to each other, by the side of those big craters.
Things like this will probably have a meaning when the final game comes out.

Its the tail of spacekraken

They are the sort of Easter Egg developers put into games, especially early on when a lot of real content has yet to appear. Same as the monoliths, they are there simply to give people something to stumble across, talk about, and go out and search for. They take much less work than proper game content, so they can be added early and cheaply:- they are very cost-effective content for the benefit of early purchasers!

Its the tail of spacekraken

I think it's more likely that they're the mighty rings the developers have been hammering into the moon to chain up the space kraken when it is captured upon the release of the next patch.

Or maybe I've just been reading too much China Mieville.
